org.glassfish.tyrus.container.grizzly.client

Class GrizzlyClientSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.glassfish.tyrus.container.grizzly.client.GrizzlyClientSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, WebSocket, ClientSocket

    public class GrizzlyClientSocket
extends Object
implements WebSocket, ClientSocket
    Implementation of the WebSocket interface.
    Author:
    Stepan Kopriva (stepan.kopriva at oracle.com), Pavel Bucek (pavel.bucek at oracle.com)

    • Field Detail

      • PROXY_URI

        public static final String PROXY_URI
        Can be used as client-side user property to set proxy.

        Value is expected to be String and represent proxy URI. Protocol part is currently ignored but must be present (URI.URI(String) is used for parsing). 

             client.getProperties().put(GrizzlyClientSocket.PROXY_URI, "http://my.proxy.com:80");
     client.connectToServer(...);
        See Also:
        EndpointConfig.getUserProperties(), Constant Field Values

      • WORKER_THREAD_POOL_CONFIG

        public static final String WORKER_THREAD_POOL_CONFIG
        Client-side property to set custom worker ThreadPoolConfig.

        Value is expected to be instance of ThreadPoolConfig, can be null (it won't be used).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTOR_THREAD_POOL_CONFIG

        public static final String SELECTOR_THREAD_POOL_CONFIG
        Client-side property to set custom selector ThreadPoolConfig.

        Value is expected to be instance of ThreadPoolConfig, can be null (it won't be used).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        bytes - optional payload. Note that payload length is restricted to 125 bytes or less.
        Returns:
        Future which could be used to control/check the sending completion state.

      • sendPong

        public Future<DataFrame> sendPong(byte[] bytes)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocket
        Sends a ping frame with the specified payload (if any).

        It may seem odd to send a pong frame, however, RFC-6455 states: "A Pong frame MAY be sent unsolicited. This serves as a unidirectional heartbeat. A response to an unsolicited Pong frame is not expected."

        Specified by:
        sendPong in interface WebSocket
        Parameters:
        bytes - optional payload. Note that payload length is restricted to 125 bytes or less.
        Returns:
        Future which could be used to control/check the sending completion state.

      • stream

                       String s)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocket
        Sends a fragment of a complete message.
        Specified by:
        stream in interface WebSocket
        Parameters:
        b - boolean indicating if this message fragment is the last.
        s - the textual fragment to send.

      • stream

        public Future<DataFrame> stream(boolean b,
                       byte[] bytes,
                       int i,
                       int i1)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocket
        Sends a fragment of a complete message.
        Specified by:
        stream in interface WebSocket
        Parameters:
        b - boolean indicating if this message fragment is the last.
        bytes - the binary fragment to send.
        i - the offset within the fragment to send.
        i1 - the number of bytes of the fragment to send.
        Returns:
        Future which could be used to control/check the sending completion state.
